description: {"blocks":[{"key":"dkk2j","text":"This protocol was used to analysis glucosylceramide and glucosylsphingosine levels in mouse brain and liver.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"53att","text":"It was also described in previous publication (Mol Cell Neurosci. 2020 Jan:102:103451, doi: 10.1016)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"8ereu","text":"1. Bead Ruptor 24 (Omni International, Kennesaw, GA)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b3ktl","text":"2. Shimadzu (Columbia, MD) Prominence HPLC system coupled with an Applied Biosystems/MDS Sciex (Ontario, Canada) 4000QTRAP mass spectrometer using multiple reaction monitoring (MRM)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8c6um","text":"3. The HPLC system consists of a CBM-20A system controller, 2 LC-20 CE pumps, a SIL-20ACHT autosampler, and a DGU-20A5R degasser.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cna6h","text":"4.  Ascentis‱ Express HILIC (4.6 × 50 mm, 2.7 μm, Supelco, Bellefonte, PA) protected with a HILIC Securityguard‱ column (4 × 3.0 mm, Phenomenex, Torrance, CA)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":12,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":111,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"etafu","text":"5.  Supelcosil‱ LC-Si (2.1 × 250 mm, 5 μm, Supelco, Bellefonte, PA) protected with a HILIC Securityguard‱ column (4 × 3.0 mm, Phenomenex, Torrance, CA)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":14,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":104,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"15snb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"2F22346A9EBA11EE931C0A58A9FEAC02","name":":registered:"}},"1":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"2F22346A9EBA11EE931C0A58A9FEAC02","name":":tm:"}},"2":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"FF7B36E99EBA11EE931C0A58A9FEAC02","name":":tm:"}},"3":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"FF7B36E99EBA11EE931C0A58A9FEAC02","name":":tm:"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fk91j","text":"The mouse brain and liver tissues ( ) are homogenized in 2% CHAPS solution (4 mL/g wet tissue) in 2 mL Omni homogenization tubes containing 8 mm ceramic beads ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":35,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5sbdu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100-300","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":5}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d3qeu","text":"The homogenates are processed on the Bead Ruptor 24 (Omni International, Kennesaw, GA) for two 30 second cycles at 5.65 m/s with a 45 second pause time. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6cjcu","text":"The brain internal standards including d5-GluCer(18:0) (250 ng/mL) for GluCer and d5-GluSph\n(200 ng/mL) for GluSph are prepared in acetonitrile solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"46v4q","text":" The samples are vortexed for approximately 3 min and then centrifuged at 10,000 rpm for 10 min. The supernatants are transferred to 1.2 mL glass inserts (VWR, West Chester, PA) in 96 well plates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9fplh","text":"A quality control (QC) sample is prepared by pooling 20% of extracts from study samples and used to monitor the instrument performance.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6ds2","text":"The crude extracts are directly injected to LC–MS/MS system for analysis of GluSph and GluCer. Injection volumes for CSF and and brain homogenates are 100 μL and 5 μL, respectively.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ekkm1","text":"LC–MS/MS analysis is conducted on a Shimadzu (Columbia, MD) Prominence HPLC system coupled with an Applied Biosystems/MDS Sciex (Ontario, Canada) 4000QTRAP mass spectrometer using multiple reaction monitoring (MRM).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4t7ru","text":"The HPLC system consists of CBM-20A system controller, 2 LC-20 CE pumps, a SIL-20ACHT autosampler, and a DGU-20A5R degasser. The compartment of the autosampler is set at 4 °C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3l15u","text":"For analysis of GluSph, the chromatography was performed at ambient temperature using Ascentis‱ Express HILIC (4.6 × 50 mm, 2.7 μm, Supelco, Bellefonte, PA) protected with a HILIC Securityguard‱ column (4 × 3.0 mm, Phenomenex, Torrance, CA)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":94,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":193,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"2F22346A9EBA11EE931C0A58A9FEAC02","name":":registered:"}},"1":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"2F22346A9EBA11EE931C0A58A9FEAC02","name":":tm:"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"882kk","text":"Mobile phase A (0.1% formic acid and 1 mM ammonium formate in water) and mobile phase B (0.1% formic acid and 1 mM ammonium formate in acetonitrile-water (95:5)) are operated with a gradient elution as follows: 0–0.2 min 100–95% B, 0.2–3.5 min 95% B, 3.5–3.9 min 95–90% B, 3.9–5.8 min 90% B, 5.8–5.9 min 90–10% B, 5.9–6.9 min 10% B, 6.9–7.0 min 10–100% B, and 7.0–8.8 min 100% B at a flow rate of 1.5 mL/min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"54ods","text":"The HPLC flow is diverted to waste except for 2.0–6.5 min to mass spectrometer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"28epa","text":"The ESI source temperature is 600 °C; the ESI needle is 5000 V; the declustering potentials for\nGluSph  is 76 V, respectively; both the entrance potential and the collision cell exit potential are 10 V for all compounds. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"d1j","text":"The collision and curtain gas are set at medium and 20, respectively.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4m0fm","text":"Both desolvation gas and nebulizing gas are set at 45. For MRM, the collision energies\nfor mass transitions of m/z 462.3 to 282.3 for GluSph and that for d5-GluSph are 31, 26, 38, and 31 V, respectively.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ahs8e","text":"The dwell time is set at 50 ms for each mass transition","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4paer","text":"For analysis of GluCer, the chromatography is performed at ambient temperature using Supelcosil‱ LC-Si (2.1 × 250 mm, 5 μm, Supelco, Bellefonte, PA) protected with a HILIC Securityguard‱ column (4 × 3.0 mm, Phenomenex, Torrance, CA).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":95,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":185,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"FF7B36E99EBA11EE931C0A58A9FEAC02","name":":tm:"}},"1":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"FF7B36E99EBA11EE931C0A58A9FEAC02","name":":tm:"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5pce","text":"Mobile phase A (5 mM ammonium acetate in water) and mobile phase B (5 mM ammonium acetate in acetonitrilemethanol-acetic acid (97:2:1)) are operated with a gradient elution as follows: 0–4.0 min 100% B, 4.0–4.1 min 100–95% B, 4.1–6.5 min 95% B, 6.5–6.6 min 95–10% B, 6.6–7.6 min 10% B, 7.6–7.7 min 10–100% B, 6.9–7.0 min 10–100% B, and 7.0–10 min 100% B at a flow rate of 1.5 mL/min. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fmv9b","text":"The HPLC flow is diverted to waste except for 2.0–6.5 min to mass spectrometer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fnukp","text":"The ESI source temperature is 550 °C; the ESI needle is 5000 V; the declustering potentials for\nGluCer is 75 V; both the entrance potential and the collision cell exit potential is 10 V for all the compounds.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7a3nv","text":"The collision and curtain gas are set at medium and 20, respectively.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5pq91","text":"The desolvation gas and nebulizing gas are set at 35 and 55, respectively.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"37ivg","text":"For MRM, the collision energies for mass transitions of m/z 700.5 to 264.3 for GluCer(16:0), m/z 728.5 to 264.3 for GluCer(18:0), m/z 756.5 to 264.3 for GluCer(20:0), m/z 784.6 to 264.3 for GluCer(22:0), m/z 812.7 to 264.3 for GluCer (24:0), m/z 810.7 to 264.3 for GluCer(24:1).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7goll","text":"The dwell time is set at 50 ms for each mass transition.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"89dmd","text":"Data processing is conducted with Analyst 1.5.1 (Applied Biosystems).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fpvh9","text":"The signal of noise ratio of analyte \u003c 3 is defined as below limit of detection (LOD).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dnuu8","text":"The relative quantification data are obtained as peak area ratios of analytes to their internal standards, which are converted to concentrations.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Glucosylceramide and glucosylsphingosine analysis
